definitions: formed by combining distinct elements or components into a unified whole
relating to the process or structure of combining elements in writing or music
examples: The compositional structure reveals underlying mathematical patterns
This compositional approach emphasizes individual building blocks
Her compositional techniques blend traditional and modern styles
The compositional choices create a unique narrative voice

definitions: consisting of two or more separate elements combined together into one
making something worse or more serious by adding to existing problems
examples: The compound structure consists of multiple chemical elements
They developed a compound solution addressing several issues
His actions compound the difficulty of the situation
These factors compound our existing financial problems

definitions: formed by combining two or more elements into a single entity
increased in severity or complexity through additional factors or problems
examples: The compounded mixture contains several active ingredients
Their compounded approach addresses multiple challenges simultaneously
His compounded errors led to the project's failure
The situation was compounded by poor communication

definitions: capable of being understood or grasped mentally by the intended audience
examples: The instructions are comprehensible to beginners
She made the complex theory comprehensible through clear examples

definitions: including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something being considered
examples: The comprehensive report covers every aspect of the issue
They conducted a comprehensive review of company policies

definitions: pressed together or into less space through applied physical force
reduced in size or duration while retaining essential information or content
examples: The compressed air powers the pneumatic tools
Keep the compressed bandage on the injured area
The compressed file takes up less storage space
She gave a compressed version of the presentation

definitions: capable of being reduced in volume through the application of pressure
examples: Gases are highly compressible compared to liquids
The compressible foam adjusts to body shape

definitions: exposing someone to danger, suspicion, or disrepute through revealing information
involving or willing to make concessions to reach mutual agreement
examples: The compromising photographs could damage her career
He found himself in a compromising position
Their compromising attitude helped resolve the dispute
She adopted a more compromising stance in negotiations

definitions: feeling an irresistible urge to behave in a certain way repeatedly
resulting from or relating to an irresistible psychological urge
examples: He's a compulsive gambler who can't stop betting
Her compulsive cleaning disrupts family life
The compulsive behavior requires professional treatment
These compulsive patterns developed during childhood

definitions: required by law or rules that must be done or obeyed
examples: Education is compulsory for children until age sixteen
The company introduced compulsory safety training sessions

definitions: relating to the use of computers or calculation in processing information
examples: The computational model predicts weather patterns accurately
She specializes in computational linguistics and natural language

definitions: having an outline or surface that curves inward like the interior of a circle
examples: The concave mirror focuses light to a single point
The concave shape collects rainwater naturally

definitions: kept secret or hidden from view or knowledge of others deliberately
examples: The concealed weapon was discovered during the search
Her concealed emotions finally surfaced during therapy

definitions: keeping something secret or preventing it from being known or seen
examples: The concealing darkness helped them escape unnoticed
His concealing behavior raised suspicions among colleagues

definitions: having an excessively high opinion of oneself or one's abilities and achievements
examples: His conceited attitude alienates potential friends
She became conceited after winning the competition

definitions: capable of being imagined, understood, or believed as possible or likely
examples: It's conceivable that prices will rise next year
Every conceivable solution has been thoroughly tested

definitions: made denser or stronger by removing water or other diluting agents
focused on a single area or purpose with intense mental effort
examples: The concentrated juice needs dilution before drinking
Use concentrated detergent for tough stains
Her concentrated effort produced excellent results
The concentrated attack overwhelmed their defenses

definitions: having a common center point, as circles or spheres one inside another
examples: The concentric circles represent different energy levels
The target has concentric rings for scoring

definitions: relating to or based on mental concepts rather than physical objects or facts
examples: The conceptual framework guides our research approach
Her conceptual art challenges traditional aesthetic boundaries

definitions: feeling worry or anxiety about something that might happen or has happened
having an interest or involvement in something or being affected by it
examples: Parents are concerned about their children's online safety
She looked concerned when hearing the news
All concerned parties must sign the agreement
The report concerns concerned citizens and officials

definitions: planned or accomplished together through mutual agreement and coordinated action
examples: Their concerted effort resulted in project success
The concerted campaign raised awareness about climate change

definitions: intended to gain goodwill or favor by making concessions to reduce hostility
examples: His conciliatory tone helped calm the angry crowd
She made conciliatory gestures toward her opponents

definitions: expressing much in few words while remaining clear and comprehensive
examples: Her concise summary captured all essential points perfectly
The manual provides concise instructions for assembly

definitions: brought to an end or finish after completing all necessary parts
examples: The concluded negotiations resulted in a peace treaty
Their concluded business allowed them to relax

definitions: serving as the final part or bringing something to its end
examples: The concluding chapter summarizes all main arguments
His concluding remarks inspired the entire audience

definitions: serving to prove a case decisively and putting an end to doubt
examples: The DNA evidence was conclusive in proving innocence
They found conclusive proof of the theory's validity

definitions: naturally accompanying or associated with something else as a consequence or result
examples: The concomitant risks of surgery must be considered
Fame brings concomitant responsibilities and pressures

definitions: made of a building material consisting of cement, sand, stones, and water
existing in a material form that can be touched or seen rather than abstract
examples: The concrete structure withstood the earthquake
They poured concrete foundations for the new building
We need concrete evidence before making accusations
Her concrete examples clarified the abstract concept

definitions: existing, happening, or done at the same time as something else
examples: The concurrent sessions offer different workshop topics
She holds concurrent positions at two universities

definitions: expressing agreement or happening at the same time as something else
examples: The judge wrote a concurring opinion supporting the verdict
Several concurring factors led to the crisis

definitions: expressing strong disapproval or criticism of someone or something
examples: Her condemning words hurt more than physical pain
The condemning report exposed widespread corruption

definitions: showing a feeling of superiority and treating others as if they are inferior
examples: His condescending manner irritates everyone he meets
She spoke in a condescending tone to the students

definitions: subject to one or more conditions being met before taking effect or happening
examples: The conditional offer depends on background verification
Their conditional support requires meeting specific criteria

definitions: trained to respond in a particular way to specific stimuli through repeated exposure
brought into a desired state through training or treatment for optimal performance
examples: The conditioned response occurs without conscious thought
Their conditioned behavior reflects years of training
The conditioned athletes performed exceptionally well
His well-conditioned muscles handled the strain easily

definitions: making a certain situation or outcome likely or possible through favorable conditions
examples: This environment is conducive to creative thinking
Warm weather is conducive to outdoor activities

definitions: having the property of transmitting heat, electricity, or sound through a material
examples: Copper is highly conductive and ideal for wiring
The conductive material allows current to flow freely

definitions: united in a league, alliance, or conspiracy for mutual support or action
examples: The confederate states formed a military alliance
Confederate forces coordinated their defensive strategies

definitions: feeling or showing certainty about one's abilities or about having something happen
examples: She feels confident about passing the examination
His confident manner impressed the interview panel

definitions: intended to be kept secret and not shared with unauthorized people
examples: The confidential documents contain sensitive information
She shared confidential details about the merger

definitions: arranged in a particular way or set up for a specific purpose or function
examples: The configured system meets all technical requirements
Their configured network ensures maximum security

definitions: restricted to a particular space or area and unable to leave freely
examples: The confined space made everyone feel claustrophobic
He remained confined to his bed during recovery

definitions: keeping someone or something within limits that prevent free movement or development
examples: The confining walls created a sense of imprisonment
Her confining schedule leaves no time for relaxation

definitions: serving to confirm or establish the truth or correctness of something previously suspected
examples: The confirmatory tests validated the initial diagnosis
They await confirmatory evidence before proceeding

definitions: established as true, genuine, or valid through evidence or formal acknowledgment
having a particular habit or condition that is long-established and unlikely to change
examples: The confirmed appointment appears in your calendar
Police confirmed reports of the incident
He's a confirmed bachelor with no plans to marry
Her confirmed pessimism affects team morale

definitions: establishing the truth, accuracy, or validity of something through evidence
examples: The confirming evidence strengthened their legal case
Her confirming nod indicated agreement with the plan

definitions: being incompatible or at variance with each other, creating contradiction or opposition
examples: The conflicting reports make it hard to determine truth
Her conflicting emotions left her feeling confused

definitions: flowing together or merging into one, especially of rivers or streams
examples: The confluent streams form a mighty river
These confluent factors created the perfect conditions

definitions: complying with rules, standards, or laws through adaptation of behavior or appearance
examples: The conforming products meet all safety regulations
His conforming behavior earned management approval

definitions: following established conventions and norms without questioning or challenging them
examples: His conformist attitude prevents creative thinking
The conformist culture discourages individual expression

definitions: bewildered and unable to understand something that seems impossible or strange
used to express annoyance or frustration about something as an intensifier
examples: Scientists remain confounded by the mysterious results
She looked confounded when hearing the news
That confounded machine never works properly
Get that confounded noise to stop immediately
